general_advisory: Farmers are advised not to burn the residue of kharif crops in the fields as it pollutes the environment and causes health problems.

advisory: In transplanted rice, apply Bensulfuron methyl 0.6% + Pretilachlor 6% GR @ 4 kg/acre with 4 kg sand at 5-8 days after transplanting.
Monitor for stem borer and apply granular Chlorantraniliprole 0.4% GR @ 4kg/acre or Cartap hydrochloride 4G @ 10 kg/acre mixing with sand if observed.
Weed after 3-4 weeks, apply gypsum @ 100 kg/acre close to the base of the plant and incorporate it into the soil. Irrigate after application.
To control tikka disease, spray Chlorothalonil 75% WP @ 2 g/litre of water or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 1.5 g/litre of water.
To control tobacco caterpillar infestation, spray Thiamethoxam 12.6% + Lambda-Cyhalothrin 9.5% ZC @ 0.3 ml/litre of water or Profenophos 50% EC @ 2 ml/litre of water.
To control aphid infestation, spray Imidacloprid 17.8 % SL @ 0.3 ml/litre of water or Thiomethaxome 25%WG @ 0.2 g/litre of water.
To control vector of YMV, spray Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.3 ml/litre of water or Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 0.2 g/litre of water.
To control shoot and fruit borer, spray Azadirachtin 1% EC @ 3 ml/litre of water or Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4 g/litre of water.
To control late blight infestation, spray Azoxystrobin 18.2% + Difenoconazole 11.4% SC @ 1 ml/litre of water or Captan 50% WP @ 2.5 g/15 litre of water.
To control leaf miner, spray Thiomethaxome 25%WG @ 0.4 g/litre of water.
To control thrips, spray Thiamethoxam 12.6% + Lambda Cyhalothrin 9.5% ZC @ 0.3 ml/litre of water or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.5 ml/litre of water.
To control mango hopper, spray Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 3 ml or Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 2 g in 10 litre of water.
When tender fruits are in pea size, spray Alpha Napthyl Acetic Acid 4.5% SL @ 4.5 ml in 10 litre of water.
